turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Transatlantic telegraph cable.
turn.1: What happened during the event of the first transatlantic telegraph message being sent?
turn.2: All on the ship cheered or wept as rockets were sent up into the sky to light the sea.
turn.3: What happened after the message was sent?
turn.4: The recovered cable was then spliced to a fresh cable in her hold, and paid out to Heart's Content, Newfoundland, where she arrived on Saturday, September 7.
turn.5: What did the arrival of the cable result in?
turn.6: There were now two working telegraph lines.
turn.7: What other events happened during this time?
turn.8: Initially messages were sent by an operator sending Morse code.
turn.9: What else did you find interesting?
turn.10: The reception was very bad on the 1858 cable, and it took two minutes to transmit just one character (a single letter or a single number), a rate of about 0.1 words per minute.
turn.12: This is despite the use of a highly sensitive mirror galvanometer, a new invention at the time.
